Module Cryptography
Package cryptography.cracking

Interface Crackable

All Known Implementing Classes:
Affine, Atbash, Cesar
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface
public interface Crackable
This interface provides ciphers the ability to crack an unknown encrypted message. Methods to decipher a message are frequency and semantic analysis.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default java.lang.String[] analyse​(SpellChecker spellChecker, java.lang.String frequency)
    Attempts to crack a message by using brute force.
    static java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.Integer> characterFrequency​(java.lang.String txt)
    Calculates the frequency of each character in the given String.
    java.lang.String[] crack()
    Attempts to crack a message by using brute force.
    default java.lang.String[] frequencyAnalysis​(java.lang.String chars)
    Attempts to crack a message by frequency analysis.
    static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> nGraph​(java.lang.String txt, int n)
    Splits the given String into graphs of n characters.
    default java.lang.String[] semanticAnalysis​(SpellChecker spellChecker)
    Attempts to crack a message by using brute force.

  • Method Details

    • crack

      java.lang.String[] crack()
      Attempts to crack a message by using brute force. The array returned by this method contains all possible solutions for the encrypted message.
      Returns:
      An array containing all possible solutions for the message

    • analyse

      default java.lang.String[] analyse​(SpellChecker spellChecker, java.lang.String frequency)
      Attempts to crack a message by using brute force. This approach uses both semantic and frequency analysis. It is a concatenation of the semanticAnalysis() and the frequencyAnalysis() method. The solutions are ordered by correctness in descending order.
      Parameters:
      spellChecker - The SpellChecker containing the semantic logic
      frequency - The characters to filter by
      Returns:
      An array containing all possible solutions for the message

    • semanticAnalysis

      default java.lang.String[] semanticAnalysis​(SpellChecker spellChecker)
      Attempts to crack a message by using brute force. In comparison to the crack() method, this method utilizes semantic logic to interpret each key's spelling. The returned array is sorted by likeliness of being correct descending order. The semantic logic is determined by the given SpellChecker.
      Parameters:
      spellChecker - The SpellChecker containing the semantic logic
      Returns:
      An array containing all possible solutions for the message

    • frequencyAnalysis

      default java.lang.String[] frequencyAnalysis​(java.lang.String chars)
      Attempts to crack a message by frequency analysis. Each character in the decrypted message that is contained in the given String earns one point. Finally, orders all ciphers based on those points, in descending order.
      Parameters:
      chars - The characters to filter by
      Returns:
      An array containing all possible solutions for the message

    • characterFrequency

      static java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.Integer> characterFrequency​(java.lang.String txt)
      Calculates the frequency of each character in the given String. The result is returned as a Map.
      Parameters:
      txt - The String to analyze
      Returns:
      A Map containing the frequency of each character in the given String

    • nGraph

      static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> nGraph​(java.lang.String txt, int n)
      Splits the given String into graphs of n characters. For example, the String "Hello, World!" can be split into: "Hel", "lo,", "Wor", "ld!", where n=3. Also, calculates the frequency of each graph in the String and returns the result as a Map.
      Parameters:
      txt - The String to analyze
      n - The length of each graph
      Returns:
      A Map containing each graph and their frequency in the String
